summary: The Expedited Delivery Act (S. 2137) amends section 3204 of title 10 of the United States Code, concerning the use of procedures other than competitive procedures for government procurement. It allows for non-competitive bidding if market research indicates differentiated capabilities, accelerated delivery, or continuous improvements. The bill also modifies dollar thresholds for justification requirements and makes other technical amendments related to the use of non-competitive procurement processes.
